Package ePortfolio

Class Investment

  • java.lang.Object
    • ePortfolio.Investment
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    MutualFund, Stock
    public abstract class Investment
extends java.lang.Object
    This class stores general attributes for an investment, and provides accessors and mutators for all of the attributes

      • Investment

        public Investment​(java.lang.String symbol,
                  java.lang.String name,
                  int quantity,
                  double price)
        Constructor with 4 parameters for symbol, name, quantity and price
        Parameters:
        symbol - string is set to symbol
        name - string is set to name
        quantity - is set as the int quantity
        price - is a double set to price The book value and gain are initialized to 0 for a new stock the book value is set in main

      • setSymbol

        public boolean setSymbol​(java.lang.String symbol)
                  throws InvalidSymbolException
        Sets the symbol based on the input symbol
        Parameters:
        symbol - is the symbol to set
        Returns:
        false if symbol is null, true otherwise
        Throws:
        InvalidSymbolException - is symbol is null or empty

        Returns:
        false if name == null true otherwise

      • setPrice

        public boolean setPrice​(double price)
                 throws InvalidPriceException
        Sets the price based on the input price
        Parameters:
        price - is the price to set
        Returns:
        true if price greater than 0
        Throws:
        InvalidPriceException - if price is less than 0

      • setGain

        public void setGain​(double newPrice)
        Sets the gain based on the the new price
        Parameters:
        newPrice - is the new price the formula is gain = (quantity*price - fee) - BookVal

      • paymentReceived

        public double paymentReceived​(int quantity)
        This calculates the payment received after selling, the fee depends on the type of investment
        Parameters:
        quantity - is the quantity that is being sold
        Returns:
        the payment recieved based on the amount sold and the current price

      • updateBookValue

        public void updateBookValue​(int oldQuantity)
        This updates the book value if a investment is sold
        Parameters:
        oldQuantity - is the old quantity of the investment it then calculates a ratio of the old and new quantity and then multiplies the book value by that ratio

      • matchingPriceRange

        public boolean matchingPriceRange​(double lowerPrice,
                                  double upperPrice)
        Matching price range matches an exact price, lower bound and/or upper bound price
        Parameters:
        lowerPrice - is the lower bound search, if the price in this stock is higher than it then it returns true
        upperPrice - is the upper range and the price in the stock must be equal to or lower than it
        Returns:
        true if the price of the investment falls within the search values

      • toFile

        public java.lang.String toFile()
        This function will write to a file in a given format
        Returns:
        the format of the file
